newsitem.title: USA: IBM in pact to extend CollegeNET service.
newsitem.headline: IBM in pact to extend CollegeNET service.

text.p: International Business Machines Corp will unveil on Tuesday a pact that will extend the reach of CollegeNET, a service that allows aspirant students to apply to colleges via the internet.
IBM said the agreement primarily involves the use of IBM's sales force to enlist North American colleges into the service.
CollegeNET is owned and operated by privately-held Universal Algorithms Inc of Portland, Oregon.
Through CollegeNET, students can apply to one or several colleges by sending pertinent data over the Internet.
The student can the send appliciation fees over a secure, private network using credit cards. Both IBM and CollegeNET will take a percentage of the fees from each transaction.
"The colleges anticipate being able to save time and money," by taking applications online, and by replying in similar fashion, the spokewoman said.
CollegeNET has already signed up about 200 colleges to the system, including Cornell University, the State University of New York system and the University of Miami.
Financial details of the deal were not disclosed.
